intro: Ceropegia gemugofana, commonly known as the Cape ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant produces small, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in groups. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires moderate watering, making it suitable for rock gardens or containers. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated for horticultural purposes.
